name.en: Cultural Economy & Agro-Rural Development of Hakka
name.ch: 文化經濟與客庄農鄉發展

department.ch: 客家語文暨社會科學學系客家社會及政策碩士班
department.en: Master Program of Hakka Social and Policy Sciences

goal.ch: 本課程旨在探究現代文化秩序與經濟秩序間交互形塑與交相構成的理論取徑，並將其作為核心架構來探索當代客庄農鄉的發展與轉型。文化與經濟日益明顯的交織運作且彼此互涉是當代社會意義深遠且影響重大的關鍵發展，本課程將通過系列新興理論架構的探究、核心辯論議題的瞭解與具啟發性經驗研究的分析來進行。文化經濟活動的形式，其基礎是產出帶有意義顯著的符號內涵與美學風格，也就是象徵產出（知識、熱情、道德、創意、感受、體驗、意像、設計、風格等）對通過市場機制與非市場機制所形成的經濟系統具有關鍵性。經驗個案將集中在與當代客庄農鄉發展較為緊密聯繫的產業，主要包括：「精緻」農業、觀光旅遊、特色飲食、節慶與襲產等。內醞關鍵文化創發特質的新興農鄉產業不僅提供經濟財富且創造象徵形式、發展創新知識，建構認同、表達願景、反映價值、促成關係且可以成為人類社會的關鍵文化資產。在此基礎上，本課程將沿著兩條軸線展開：其一，從不同的新興社會理論傳統來探索並釐清「文化經濟」此具有軸心地位的現象與概念架構。另一方面，運用文化經濟的取徑並以將社會關係與文化過程以更完整、更豐富且更貼近真實的分析方式，來瞭解當代客庄農鄉發展的運作與意涵。
goal.en: This course aims to explore the theoretical approach of the interactive shaping and intersecting formation of modern cultural order and economic order, and use it as the core framework to explore the development and transformation of contemporary Hakka villages. The increasingly evident intertwining and interplay of culture and economy is a key development of profound significance and impact in contemporary society. This course will be carried out through the exploration of a series of emerging theoretical frameworks, understanding of core debate issues and analysis of enlightening empirical research. . The form of cultural and economic activities is based on the output of significant symbolic connotations and aesthetic styles, that is, symbolic output (knowledge, enthusiasm, morality, creativity, feelings, experience, imagery, design, style, etc.) The economic system formed by mechanism and non-market mechanism is crucial. Experience cases will focus on industries that are closely related to the development of contemporary Hakka farming and rural areas, mainly including: “exquisite“ agriculture, sightseeing and tourism, special catering, festivals and traditional production, etc. Emerging agricultural and rural industries with key cultural creation characteristics not only provide economic wealth but also create symbolic forms, develop innovative knowledge, construct identity, express vision, reflect value, and promote relationships, and can become key cultural assets of human society. On this basis, this course will be developed along two axes: first, to explore and clarify the central phenomenon and conceptual framework of “cultural economy“ from different emerging social theory traditions. On the other hand, using the approach of cultural economy and analyzing social relations and cultural processes in a more complete, richer and closer to the real way, we can understand the operation and meaning of the development of contemporary Hakka farms and villages.
